descriptions: Fails to identify or recognize any emotions (fear, stress, anger, loss, grief) in oneself or others.
Identifies only one emotion with limited accuracy.
Identifies two emotions, but demonstrates a superficial understanding.
Identifies most emotions and demonstrates a basic understanding of their triggers and manifestations.
Accurately identifies all emotions and demonstrates a solid understanding of their triggers and manifestations.
Accurately identifies all emotions, demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of their triggers and manifestations, and articulates the complexity of emotional experiences.
Unable to evaluate or suggest any coping strategies for dealing with emotions.
Suggests one or two coping strategies, but they are ineffective or inappropriate.
Suggests a few coping strategies with limited evaluation of their effectiveness.
Evaluates several coping strategies and identifies some benefits and drawbacks.
Evaluates a range of coping strategies and provides a detailed analysis of their effectiveness and suitability for different situations.
Evaluates a wide array of coping strategies, provides a nuanced analysis of their effectiveness and suitability, and demonstrates an understanding of personalized approaches to emotional regulation.
Unable to apply coping strategies to oneself or others.
Demonstrates difficulty in applying coping strategies to either oneself or others.
Applies coping strategies to either oneself or others with limited effectiveness.
Applies coping strategies to both oneself and others with some degree of effectiveness.
Effectively applies coping strategies to both oneself and others, demonstrating empathy and understanding.
Skillfully applies coping strategies to both oneself and others, demonstrating empathy, understanding, and adaptability in diverse situations.
Shows no understanding of the long-term impact of unmanaged emotions.
Demonstrates a limited awareness of the long-term impact of unmanaged emotions.
Recognizes some potential long-term consequences of unmanaged emotions.
Understands the potential long-term consequences of unmanaged emotions on mental and physical health.
Articulates the long-term consequences of unmanaged emotions and the importance of proactive coping strategies.
Provides a comprehensive analysis of the long-term consequences of unmanaged emotions, emphasizing the importance of resilience and proactive strategies for maintaining well-being.
